subject: Clutch Stopped Working Randomly
description_text:
Hello there!

So, I was just inquiring as if there was anything that could be done about
my situation. I bought my Simsonn Pro pedals last year, Nov 18, 2024 from
amazon.ca. My order number is: *702-3257287-9674606*. I have treated my
pedals well, they're all in great condition, and I actually hadn't used
them in a few months. But the last time I did, everything was working as
expected. Today I went to drive with them, and found that my clutch pedal
was not registering in game. I tried it out in SimPedalsConfig_4.1106,
which is what I set them up in originally, and the clutch is not
registering at all. It shows no pressure or input, and i've tried to
mess with the dock, reset my pc, use a different USB port, moved the
grounding wire, checked the condition of the wire and the hub as well, and
everything looks fine, but the pedal just does not work at all.

I'm not sure if your warranty period runs for one or two years after
purchase, so i'm not quite sure if there is anything that can be done here,
but I was hoping that maybe you could help me out, as I'm sad my pedal is
no longer working. my pedals seem to be out of date, as I only see listings
of the Pro X/ Ultra and Plus X, so I'm worried I can't even get a
replacement.

Thanks for your time,

Seage~


-- 
Courtney Howlett | Seage
Illustrator | Storyteller
Seageart.com <http://seageart.com/>

conversations.body_text: Hi Courtney Howlett,  Only pedals with firmware version 1.7.1 are compatible with SIMSONN Manager 2.1.2. If the software indicates that the firmware is too old, please go to Settings → Update → Manual Firmware Update → pedals-firmware → pedals-plus.sfu to update it. If your pedals are running version 1.7.0, they do not support the latest software.      https://www.simsonn.com/pages/download
